page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: Early education was linked with the Church. There was a college for priests & laymen in the 15th century. In 1710 a charity school was established and by the 19th century there were 7 schools in the village. A purpose built school which became the Staindrop National school was opened in 1841 & in 1847 an Infant's school was built by the Duke of Cleveland. In 1902 the schools came under the auspices of DCC & scholarships to Grammar schools in Bp. Auckland were made available. The schools became church controlled in 1951.The present school was built in 1968, with about 120 pupils & 5 teaching staff. The pupils come from a four mile radius, by minibus & taxi. There is also a comprehensive school with 725 pupils & 41 teachers + head. It opened in 1963 & draws pupils from a 10 mile radius.
